||36|| 14 || 8 || 14 || 44 || 36 || +8 || 50 | style="background:silver;"| RU || || || || Todor Nedelev || 14 || 1,946 |} == Key == {| class="wikitable" |- |bgcolor=gold|Winners | style="background:silver;"|Runners-up | style="background:#c96;"|Third/SF | style="background:#cfc;"|Promotion | style="background:#fcc;"|Relegation |} * Pos - Position * Pts - Points * Pl - Matches Played * GF - Goals Scored * GA - Goals Against * BG Cup - Bulgarian Cup * SA Cup - Cup of the Soviet Army / Soviet Army Cup * SC - Supercup * IC – Intertoto Cup * ICFC – Inter-Cities Fairs Cup * BC – Balkans Cup * EL – Europa League Notes: * Season 1958 is a transition season so everyone plays only one time against one another * The Bulgarian Cup is firstly named "Cup of the Soviet Army". After the establishment of the "Bulgarian Cup", the "Cup of the Soviet Army" becomes a secondary tournament, before ceasing to exist in 1990.. * UC – UEFA Cup * CWC – Cup Winners' Cup * EC – European Cup * n/a - The competition hasn't been established yet, has ceased to exist or there is no information. * GP – Group Phase * W - Winners * RU - Runners-up * SF - Semi-finals * QF - Quarter-finals * R16/R32/R64 - Round of 16, Round of 32, Round of 64 * R1 - Round 1 * During the 2009/10 season, Botev was deducted 6 points because of administrative irregularities. After the first half of the season, the club was expelled from the league and all of their remaining fixtures were counted as 3-0 wins for their opponents. == References == * PFC Botev Plovdiv seasons Botev Plovdiv
title: List of PFC Botev Plovdiv seasons
